problems.title: Max Consecutive Ones After Flipping At Most K Zeros
problems.description:
Given a binary array (containing only 0s and 1s) and an integer K, you are allowed to flip at most K zeros to ones. Find the maximum number of consecutive ones you can obtain in the array after at most K flips.

Input Format:
First line: two integers n and K.
Second line: n space-separated integers (each 0 or 1).

Output Format:
Print a single integer: the maximum number of consecutive ones possible.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
7 1
1 0 1 1 0 1 1

Sample Output
5

Explanation:
Flipping the zero at index 1 gives: [1,1,1,1,0,1,1] with a maximum run of 4 ones. Flipping index 4 gives [1,0,1,1,1,1,1] with a maximum run of 5 ones, which is optimal.
problems.constraints:
1 <= n <= 100000
0 <= K <= n
Each element is 0 or 1.

If the number of zeros exceeds K, move the left pointer forward until the count of zeros is at most K again, updating the maximum window size.
